summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 discussing logistical planning for a briefing meeting between the Department of Justice and victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve DOJ officials, FBI Victim Services personnel, and victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, focusing on selecting a location in Florida and scheduling the meeting.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the attorneys representing Epstein victims, consulted about the logistics for a victim briefing meeting, suggesting Florida as the best location.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Brad Edwards as an attorney representing Epstein victims, consulted about the logistics for a victim briefing meeting.

connections.description: Both are attorneys representing victims of Jeffrey Epstein and are mentioned together as being consulted for planning a victim briefing.

events.title: Planning for Victim Briefing Meeting
events.description: DOJ and FBI Victim Services personnel coordinate with victims' attorneys to plan a briefing meeting for Epstein victims, with a preference for a location in Florida due to victim proximity and pandemic travel concerns.

locations: Miramar (implied location of FBI field office)
keyFacts: In October 2020, the DOJ was planning a briefing meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

Victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell were consulted and recommended Florida as the meeting location, citing that most of their client victims lived there and preferred not to travel during the pandemic.
An FBI building in Broward County (likely Miramar) was suggested as a potential venue for the meeting.
The email chain reveals coordination between the DOJ's National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator, FBI Victim Services Division, and victims' legal representatives.
The planning indicates ongoing official engagement with Epstein victims years after his death and the initial investigations.
